title: run: shouldn't it fail by default if no inputs are available?

and the feedback was only `[WARNING] Input does not exist: /mnt/btrfs/scrap/shub/datalad-monolith/*/*/*/error-*` .  Why don't we just error out?  Is there some use case where we do want inputs to not be valid?

datalad `0.14.1.dev136` (0.14.1-136-g6d3ac7e85)

Also I guess with mis-specification somehow just wiped out `inputs` and thus triggered assumption that the entire dataset is the input/output, since even with  `--explicit` it did process all files in the dataset.  IMHO that is also not quite right.
